Stuff the Bus is working on its annual campaign to assist students in the Waverly Community School District who are in need of supplies for the start of the school year.

Due to the COVID-19 outbreak, organizers will not be collecting supplies for donor and student safety. This year, an Amazon Wishlist and online donation bank will be created for you to continue to support this program. Items purchased on the Amazon Wishlist will be shipped directly to the school and given to students in need. Money donated will go to purchase any items still needed for students. More information about the Amazon Wishlist and donation site will be given soon.

Stuff the Bus has been helping students for many years and hopes to do so for years to come. Without the generous support of the community this program would not be possible.

Those with any questions are encouraged to contact Kara Strode at kstrode@waverlyscotties.com.

Thank you to all for your continued support of the Stuff the Bus program.

Due to numerous reported illnesses and multiple children absent from school, we want to reach out to make all aware of how the school is trying to keep germs at bay as best as possible. After school today, February 3, 2020, each room will be disinfected with professional grade fumigation and surfaces will be wiped down and disinfected.

If your child is not feeling well, please take their temperature. If their temperature is 100F or higher, they will need to stay home to help eliminate spreading germs. A child who has a fever may return to school when he or she is 24 hours fever free without the aid of medication. If your child is vomiting, it is very crucial that we stress the importance of proper hand washing and disinfecting surfaces, clothes, backpacks, etc. at home to help eliminate further cross contamination at school.

Thank you for helping us keep our students healthy!
